---
title: "topbar_color.yml"
---

## High-level description
This YAML file defines configuration settings for a user interface (UI) component, specifically the top bar. It specifies the color and label for the top bar of an application or website.

## Symbols

### `ui`
#### Description
The root configuration object for user interface settings.

#### Internal Logic
Contains nested configuration options for various UI components.

### `ui.topbar`
#### Description
Configuration settings specific to the top bar of the user interface.

#### Internal Logic
Defines visual and textual properties of the top bar.

### `ui.topbar.color`
#### Description
Specifies the color of the top bar.

#### Outputs
| Name | Type | Description |
|:-----|:-----|:------------|
| color | string | Hexadecimal color code for the top bar |

#### Internal Logic
The color is set to "#42bda0", which represents a shade of teal or turquoise.

### `ui.topbar.label`
#### Description
Defines the text label to be displayed in the top bar.

#### Outputs
| Name | Type | Description |
|:-----|:-----|:------------|
| label | string | Text to be shown in the top bar |

#### Internal Logic
The label is set to "World", which will be displayed in the top bar of the UI.

## Configuration
| Option | Type | Default | Description |
|:-------|:-----|:--------|:------------|
| ui.topbar.color | string | "#42bda0" | Hexadecimal color code for the top bar |
| ui.topbar.label | string | "World" | Text label to be displayed in the top bar |

This YAML configuration file is likely part of a larger system that uses these settings to customize the appearance and content of a user interface's top bar. The file's location in the `internal/config/testdata/ui/` directory suggests it may be used for testing purposes, possibly to verify that the application correctly reads and applies UI configuration settings.
